item.title: Importing Laptops Into India Will Now Require a Permit
item.description: India is making it harder to import laptops, tablets and other consumer-electronics devices to boost local manufacturing and curb imports from China, government and industry officials said.

item.title: Credit Agricole Profit Jump as Insurance Lifts Revenue
item.description: Credit Agricole reported a second-quarter net profit of €2 billion on sales that rose 19%, boosted by insurance income, with €1 billion in net inflows at its asset-management business.

item.title: Maersk Sees Improved Outlook as Cost Cuts Offset Lower Earnings
item.description: Maersk posted a sharp drop in second-quarter net profit, as freight rates and volumes fell, but cost-cutting helped it beat expectations and prompted the company to raise the lower end of its full-year guidance range.

item.title: WPP Cuts Guidance After Profit Slump
item.description: WPP sees like-for-like growth in revenue of 1.5%-3% in 2023, with headline operating profit margin still expected to be around 15%, after it reported a below-forecast profit for the first half hit by a slowdown in U.S. tech spending.

item.title: WPP's 2Q Organic Growth Miss, Cut Outlook Seen As Disappointing
item.description: WPP’s disappointing second-quarter organic growth and outlook cut for the year is unhelpful but may already be in the price to some extent, Citi said, as the ad group’s shares open almost 7% lower.

item.title: Value Seen in Duration When 10-Year Bund Yields Rise Above 2.50%
item.description: There is value in progressively buying duration when the 10-year German Bund yield moves above 2.5%, and adding to long on dips, Societe Generale said.

item.title: AngloGold Ashanti Earnings Hit by Brazil Writedowns
item.description: AngloGold Ashanti reported lower first-half headline earnings of $140 million, in line with its guidance, as it booked impairments in its Brazilian portfolio, and forecast capex this year of up to $1.1 billion.

item.title: China's Central Bank Pledges to Flexibly Use RRR Cuts, Other Policy Tools
item.description: The People’s Bank of China will need to flexibly use monetary policy tools to ensure ample liquidity in the country’s banking system, a senior central bank official said.

item.title: Vonovia Keeps Guidance Despite Weaker First Half
item.description: Vonovia reported lower revenue and earnings in the first half, and said group funds from operations also fell, but it confirmed its outlook for the year.

item.title: China Scraps Tariffs on Australian Barley
item.description: China’s Ministry of Commerce said it would scrap tariffs on Australian-imported barley, in the latest sign of improving ties between Beijing and Canberra.

item.title: Commerzbank Lifts Outlook After Record Interest Income
item.description: Commerzbank forecast net interest income of at least €7.8 billion in 2023 after it hit a record in the second quarter, helping push profits higher.

item.title: Swiss Re Profit Surges on Lower Natural-Catastrophe Losses
item.description: Swiss Re posted a higher net profit of $804 million in the second quarter, helped by a low natural-catastrophe burden in its property-and-casualty segment, and maintained its 2023 profit target of more than $3 billion.

item.title: American Travelers Are Shunning U.S. for Europe
item.description: Domestic ticket fares are falling as travelers favor longer trips abroad.

item.title: How the World's Biggest Cruise Ship Is Docked, Explained by a Captain
item.description: A Royal Caribbean captain explains how he docks a 1,188-foot cruise ship at Port Canaveral, Fla., and how environmental conditions pose the biggest challenge.

item.title: AB InBev said its U.S. sales, profit and market share fell sharply in the second quarter as consumers abandoned Bud Light after a promotion it did with a transgender influencer.
item.description: AB InBev said its U.S. sales, profit and market share fell sharply in the second quarter as consumers abandoned Bud Light after a promotion it did with a transgender influencer.

item.title: Disney's ESPN is hunting for a strategic partner as it tries to bring order to the messy world of streaming and secure its own future.
item.description: Disney’s ESPN is hunting for a strategic partner as it tries to bring order to the messy world of streaming and secure its own future.

item.title: The American Academy of Pediatrics plans to review the evidence for gender-affirming medical care and potentially amend its policies that help guide doctors and clinicians providing the treatment to transgender youth.
item.description: The American Academy of Pediatrics plans to review the evidence for gender-affirming medical care and potentially amend its policies that help guide doctors and clinicians providing the treatment to transgender youth.

item.title: Striking Los Angeles hotel workers are calling for a levy on employers to subsidize the construction of affordable employee housing, saying inflation has eroded their previous wage increases.
item.description: Striking Los Angeles hotel workers are calling for a levy on employers to subsidize the construction of affordable employee housing, saying inflation has eroded their previous wage increases.

item.title: Israeli military reservists began skipping duty, following through on a threat from thousands of their peers to suspend service after the government moved to limit the Supreme Court's power.
item.description: Israeli military reservists began skipping duty, following through on a threat from thousands of their peers to suspend service after the government moved to limit the Supreme Court’s power.

item.title: The UAW is pressing the Detroit car companies to give its factory workers a 40% pay hike over four years in the next labor contract, an increase that would be the largest in recent memory.
item.description: The UAW is pressing the Detroit car companies to give its factory workers a 40% pay hike over four years in the next labor contract, an increase that would be the largest in recent memory.
